beantype.name: org.rapidbeans.rapidenv.config.Include
beantype.description: A pseudo configuration element to include other files containing parts of a project (environment) definition. Splitting up a project definition in different files has two advantages: 1) It simply improves the structure and maintainability of a large environment definition. 2) Partial project definitions might be reused in different environment definitions. Include elements are processed in advance and put together into one single big XML document by a fuzzy RapidEnv preprocessor. Please note you must write the whole include XML element in one single line in order to be processed correctly. Another pseudo element <projectpart> will serve as the root element for partial definitions however with the current DTD approach <installunit> is a syntactically valid root element as well.

property.name: file
property.description: A relative or absolute path to the file to be included (e. g. <include file="../inc/envincl.xml"/>).
